reviewText: KISS live in vegas is by far the cheapest video they made 4 songs not that great performence at $.I love every video they made,exposed,konfidential,pretty much all their videos but this isnt a video its just 4 songs.If you do an actual concert ,fine film it and sell it but dont come up with something like this.The 4 songs are;Shout it out loud,love gun,god of thunder,rock n roll all nite.Yes thats very short airing time If they tough *this* would bring money then its pretty stupid because it doesnt at all!Hey were KISS fans not idiots!As a rewiewer said KISS did not endorse this release wich makes it much clearer.If you like KISS then dont buy this!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I am a big admirere of KISS. But I say, is this really worth the money???It's true that this DVD has only four songs. I know that because I own it and that is really poor and a very violent low punch. And what happened to Ace and Peter: Ace looks really fat and old, and Peter seems to be spent out, he barely plays the drums hard enough. But the fact is if you're wondering why I gave this DVD four stars, is because I think the concert was very well played and very well planned, except for the part that it has four songs, you should check my review for more info:1.- "Introduccion".- The introduction is when comedian David Spade and the most downloaded woman on the planet, Cindy Morgalis, speak about KISS. This is not a song, so it doesn't count.2.- "Shout It Out Loud".- The small but powerfull concert starts with this KISS all-time classic.- 9/10.3.- "Love Gun".- Another KISS classical song from the 70's. I think this one is the best on this DVD.- 10/10.4.- "God Of Thunder".- For me another KISS classic. I think "Love Gun" and this one are the best in this DVD. In this song there are tons of fireworks.- 10/10.5.- "Rock And Roll All Night".- This is the last song in this DVD. Paul destroys his guitar at the end.- 9/10.They added another part after "Rock And Roll All Night". It is the same concert all over again, but with four angles that divide the T.V. into four. I also rated this product with four stars because the concert no at all sucks (if you have realized that above in this review). There are also tons of special features, sucha as:- Interview with the band upon the eve of their farewell tour.- Footage of the band launching their first ever THEATRICAL FILM: "DETROIT ROCK CITY" with a mini performance at the premier.- Gene and Paul's appearence at the "HOLLYWOOD TOUR RECORDS" to release their BOX SET.- KISS reciving their star on HOLLYWOOD'S WALK OF FAME.- A tribute band (LARGER THAN LIFE) playing some big hits such as "Deuce", "Strutter", etc.And there are many more other special characteristics on this DVD. Buy this one if you're a DIE-HARD KISS fan. If you think this is not worth the money....then don't. But I recomend you do so...KISS RULES !!!!!!!!!!!

reviewText: While shopping at the mall earlier today, I found two dvds that interested me. One was this dvd "Kiss Live In Las Vegas" and the other was "Tina Turner - All The Best Live". I considered what to buy for a few minutes (I was on a pretty tight budget) and I decided get the Kiss dvd. Boy, did I make a big mistake.This Kiss dvd is supposed to be the concert that was to broadcast over the internet in 1999 but wasn't due to various technical problems. Judging from this hackjob of a performance, it should have been left alone.What you get is four (I repeat four) below average performances of the Kiss standards "Shout It Out Loud", "Love Gun" (which I loathe), "God Of Thunder" and "Rock And Roll All Nite". That's it. Oh yeah, and you can watch it with two different camera angles. Wow!If they wanted to make this a great concert, here's what I would have wanted the setlist to be:"Strutter""Deuce""I Love It Loud""Calling Dr. Love""Beth""Christine Sixteen""I Was Made For Lovin' You""Heaven's On Fire""Detroit Rock City""A World Without Heroes""I Stole Your Love""Hard Luck Woman""Shout It Out Loud""Lick It Up""Forever""Rock And Roll All Nite""God Gave Rock And Roll To You II"But I guess we are stuck with this insipid crap. I'm still a huge Kiss fan, but my experiece has definitely been jaded.
summary: I Passed Up Tina Turner For This?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ok. before I recieved this DVD I read Alot of reviews with complaints that it was not a full concert...I had misgivings at first, but if you read the jacket on th DVD.  It is EXACTLY what is supposed to be...a DVD of the proformance in LasVegas that was meant origionally for internet broadcast.  The show itself was no longer than 4 songs...that was it.  No one missed anything more...4 songs end of show.  Thats all there ever was.  It was never supposed to be a full concert.  The DVD itself was excellant.  I thought the picture and sound quallity were great.  The 4 camera angle feature let you see what everyone was doing throughout the show.  I thought the directors version was great!MOST OF ALL, I enjoyed the extras...the interviews, the box set signings,and the proformances of the tribute band.  They were GREAT!  I think that for what it was the DVD was GREAT!  I did not feel shortchanged, or mislead...of course, I read the package BEFORE I watched it!
summary: Live in Las Vegas unseen internet broadcast

Not the unseen 4 songs from the Vegas concert.  I wanted the best, but I got the worst!  DON'T BUY IT!!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: I'm only a small step away from saying this was a waste of money. For starters, the Las Vegas concert seemed incredibly short (only 4 songs; there had to be more than that!), and much of the time, the audio track didn't match the video; not that it was sequenced badly, but with the exception of the band introduction and the banter with the audience in between songs, which were obviously live, it's like the music was culled from a totally different concert, or was touched up after the fact.  Examples: watch closely and you'll see things in spots like Paul Stanley visibly singing into his mike and no vocals are heard; cymbal crashes on the drum track and Peter Criss is not even hitting the cymbals; explosion sounds happen nearly 3 seconds after the pyrotechnics were set off, etc.On the upside, the video quality is great, with a "multicam" presentation available, showing the concert in 4 different camera angles; and the 5.1 surround sound is good (but again, is the music actually from the Vegas show? I have my doubts).  There are an abundance of bonus materials here (which is why I gave this 3 stars; otherwise it would've gotten only 2), some interviews that were from the "Revenge"-era with Bruce Kulick and Eric Singer.  The high point of the bonus materials is the concert footage of KISS-tribute band "Larger Than Life", who did a great job visually and musically; however, their excellent performance suffered greatly from the amateurish camera work and the murky, distorted sound.Hardcore KISS fans will probably enjoy this, but more so for the bonus materials rather than the actual concert. If you're expecting a full-length show, you're in for a big letdown, because it ain't happening.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's pretty cool to watch but no too great. I just like to hear "Love Gun". Another disappointment is that they're lip syncing their songs. It's their own voices but it still kinda sucks. You can clearly see Paul make a mistake by walking too far away from the mic and having to hurry back but his voice is already hear saying "LOOK OUT" in the middle of "Love Gun". He smiles at the crowd as he notices his mistake. It's not really a waste of money but it's not really a must have either. But they look great.
summary: Not too bad, not too good.

reviewText: I'm a huge KISS fan.  KISS fans know there are hundreds of concerts they could put on DVD.  Can we get a full-length make-up concert for crying out loud?  This DVD just has a few songs.  I wish Gene would concentrate on why we like KISS and less time on making KISS coffins...credit cards....Live CD's and DVD's, preferably stuff we haven't heard or seen before.  Let's get it right for a change.

reviewText: KISS Live in Las Vegas is NOT an official KISS release.  The band attempted to stop the release of this DVD, but failed.  The company that put it out cashed in on the rights that they had acquired to this show and released what is generally accepted as a very poor DVD.Only a few songs, not the best camera work or sound quality - this is for completists only.  When even KISS doesn't want something released, you know it is very likely to be pretty bad....Buyer beware.
summary: NOT An Official KISS Release!!!  Caveat Emptor!

reviewerName: John S. Harris "The Voice of Reason"
reviewText: Not much pre-release info to indicate that this is actually only a four-song concert.  Not such a great show, either.  The band looks kind of bored, like they are just going through the motions.  Paul is wearing a wig.  Peter looks like he could fall asleep at any moment.  And the show production is on a smaller scale than usual for a KISS show.  Granted, this was never intended to be a full-length concert.  Rather, KISS was just one a several acts slated to perform for that event, but this DVD just covers the KISS set and some marginally interesting bonus footage.  There is concert footage and an interview with "Larger Than Life", a KISS tribute band.  There are a lot of KISS tribute bands out there.  Many of them claim to be the "Official Tribute Band", or "KISS's Favorite Tribute Band", or something like that.  I don't think "Larger Than Life" is the best one, though.  I've seen "KISS Army" and "Destroyer", and those two blow "Larger Than Life" out of the water.  So don't expect any earth-shattering tribute band concert footage on this DVD.  There is some footage of Gene and Paul at a Tower Records store appearance.  The footage could have stood some trimming - it just kind of rambles on and on and is not terribly interesting.  The KISS concert footage is edited in extremely rapid-fire cuts, dizzying even by MTV standards.  It gets difficult to watch sometimes.  The cuts come so fast that your brain barely registers the image on the screen before the next image comes.  All in all, not quite the DVD concert many KISS fans were hoping this would be.  Just as well, though.  This particular concert performance is so lackluster (by KISS standards) that we are actually spared from seeing a longer version.  As a long-time KISS fan I hate to say anything unflattering about them, but in the case of this DVD you may be better off by seeking concert footage elsewhere.  KISS has already released a bunch of long-form videos on VHS and DVD.  Any of those would be superior to this Las Vegas letdown.  Sorry.
Title: N/A

reviewText: Please take note that this KISS live in Vegas is not an official KISS product, it's not licensed by KISS in any way. So instead of buying this, buy KISS Symphony.

reviewText: I rated it "one star" because I didn't find "0 stars"!This is the worst cheat KISS can do on their millions and milions of fans worldwide. Aren't they satisfied with the zillions of dollar$ they already have? Is Mr. Simmons never satisfied when it comes to money (our money, by the way)?I found the DVD and bought it immediately as a loyal KISS fan 'cos it read "Live in Las Vegas", so I thought "this is the so-long-waited concert DVD". But I was SO SO dissapointed to find only 4 songs, that I just wanted to thrash the damned thing through the window."Bonus" items use more than 80% of the disc. "Bonus" is supposed to be a small extra thing, right? But hell no! It is almost all of the disk and the performance is almost nothing as opposed to what is offered in the DVD cover. I bought the DVD to watch KISS play, not a bunch of guys playing KISS covers (altough they play really good). For that matter, it should've been labelled "KISS Tribute" instead of "KISS Live in Las Vegas".If this is not enough to keep you away from it: most of the bonus interviews are done with a HandyCam, all the time moving and with an inintelligible sound (as if it was recorded inside a shoe box). As if you were there with your own HandyCam taping the interviews. This is not what you'd expect from a DVD product, it is simply not admissible.And some of the interviews are really old -the Kulick era, the Hollywood stars-, with bad image quality, bad sound, when you'd expect more from the original members (also from the DVD cover, you'd expect more from the Psycho Circus or the Farewell Tours)....
summary: KISS FANS: DON'T BUY THIS [JUNK]!!!!! IT REALLY [STINKS]!!!!

Title: N/A

reviewText: Some previous reviewers issued disclaimers saying that the band had no blame in this terrible concoction.  Another reviewer said that the fans should have done their research, as if to say "it's your own damn fault"  to those who bought this lemon.But the band does  DOES deserve some of the blame for ever having done this stupid Vegas show in the first place.  As we see in the obnoxious little intro, this was not a KISS concert at all.  Rather, KISS was included on the bill with a number of other bands.  The kings of rock and roll shouldn't stoop so low as to share the bill with a half dozen other bands that are not as good as KISS.  They are just too good for that.And let's face it fellow fans;  the guys agreed to do a MINI KISS CONCERT!  A Reader's Digest version of the greatest show on earth!  That's just plain sacrilege!  It's iconoclasm at its worst and its a mockery of a great band.  Being the business genius that he is, Gene should have known that this thing would find its way onto store shelves.None of this would have happened if KISS had beaten them to the punch.  They should have released a live DVD, since their fans will never again get to seem them live.  The fans are itching for a DVD like this, and Pixelworks (or whoever they are)  took advantage of this.Shame on all of you!!
summary: Deceptively Packaged and Just Plain Rotten

reviewText: No Place List the contents of this item that I know of:The intro animations on the DVD are great.There is some dwelling on a woman called "Cindy Margolis", who-ever she is.KISS do Four Songs...In order, SHOUT IT OUT LOUD, LOVE GUN, GOD OF THUNDER, ROCK AND ROLL AND NITE.Thats it for the "concert"; Good Camera work, not long at all.The so called "extra Features" are-KISS ARMY FANS-GENE AND PAUL AT TOWER RECORDS-INTERVIEW with the Tribute Band "LARGER THAN LIFE"-Tribute Band "LARGER THAN LIFE" performance at the Key Club- Farewell Tour Interview with the Band.-Gene and Paul Rock Walk Induction-Peter Criss Rock Walk Induction- Ace Frehley Rock Walk Induction- Hollwood Walk of Fame Induction- Detroit Rock City PremiereThere is some material from the release of the ALIVE III period.Much of the time its like a Boot leg tape, with lengthy periods of inaudible sound.Bits and Pieces are interesting.The band LARGER THAN LIFE do more music than KISS, and the worst thing is that it is badly edited together. It is revealed that the Guy who does Gene from LARGER THAN LIFE is Gene's stand in for DETROIT ROCK CITY.Lots of gems through the dvd, but mostly contains stuff viewable elsewhere.The Farewell Interview is almost word for word the same as the VH1 special interview.Nice gift for me, I'm not unhappy with it as a fan, but way too much fluff.
Title: N/A
